stem: A 70-year-old client with a history of chronic alcohol use and heart failure is reporting sudden heart palpitations and nausea. Based on the documentation in the Cardiovascular & Micro-Electrolyte Panel tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: New onset cardiac irritability in a client on Digoxin.
Background: Heart failure (LVEF 30%). Also receiving diuretic therapy.
Assessment: Heart rate is irregular. Client is reporting 'skipping' sensations in the chest.
Recommendation: Evaluate for electrolyte disturbances.

tabs.title: Micro-Electrolyte & Cardiac Panel
tabs.content:
TestResultPrevious (Baseline)
Serum Digoxin1.9 ng/mL (High-Normal)1.1 ng/mL
Serum Magnesium (Mg++)1.1 mEq/L (Critical Low)1.9 mEq/L
Serum Potassium (K+)3.6 mEq/L (Normal)4.0 mEq/L
Serum Calcium8.8 mg/dL9.0 mg/dL

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 102/64, HR 108 (Irregular), RR 20, SpO2 94% on RA.

actionOptions.text: Hold all scheduled doses of Digoxin
Administer Magnesium Sulfate IV as prescribed
Encourage the client to drink large amounts of orange juice

parameterOptions.text: Continuous rhythm monitoring for PVCs or Torsades de Pointes
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This client has Hypomagnesemia-Potentiated Digoxin Toxicity (c2). While his Digoxin level (1.9) is technically within the 0.5-2.0 range, the severe low Magnesium (1.1) increases the sensitivity of the myocardium to the toxic effects of digoxin, leading to palpitations and potential arrhythmias. The nurse must hold the drug (a1) and correct the magnesium deficit (a2). Key parameters: EKG rhythm (p1) and magnesium trends (p2).
clinicalPearls: Low Potassium and Low Magnesium are the two biggest fans of Digoxin toxicity.
Low Mag can also lead to Torsades de Pointes (a lethal rhythm).
Alcohol use is a primary cause of hypomagnesemia due to poor intake and renal wasting.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Numerical ranges are useless if the patient is symptomatic. If the Mag or K+ is low, even a 'normal' digoxin level can be fatal.

mnemonic.title: Low Mag-Dig
mnemonic.expansion: Low Mag means the heart is on edge; Digoxin pushes it over the ledge.
